required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The DIET Trial - Dietetic Intervention in Psoriatic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Dietary Intervention Program on Disease Activity, Metabolism and Oxidative Stress in Patients With Psoriatic Arthritis and Psoriasis Activity: A Clinical, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Psoriasis (Ps) and psoriatic arthritis (PsA) are associated with increased risk of metabolic syndrome (MetS), body fatness and cardiovascular risk. Additionally, oxidative stress and inflammation are also contributing mechanisms on Ps and PsA. However, little is known about the influence of diet and micronutrients on the main outcomes of these diseases. The aim of the investigators is to evaluate the effectiveness of an intervention diet program on disease activity, metabolic profile and oxidative stress inpatients with Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the increase of Minimal Disease Activity (MDA) after intervention

secondary_outcome.description: To analyze the decrease of Fat Mass Index (kg/m^2)
To evaluate the increase of Muscle Mass (kg)
To observe the improvement of waist circumference (cm)
To analyze the improvement of Body Mass Index (kg/m^2)
To analyze the decrease of receptor for advanced glycation end products receptor (RAGE)
To analyze the increase of adiponectin
To analyze the improvement of malondialdehyde (TBARs)
To observe the improvement of LDL fractions
To evaluated the reduction in cutaneous activity, evaluated by PASI (Psoriasis Area Severity Index)
To evaluate the decrease of articular activity, evaluated by DAS28-CRP (Disease Activity Score-C reactive protein) and DAS28-ESR (Disease Activity Score-Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate).

intervention.description: Supplementation of 1g of fish oil, 3 time a day, and hypocaloric diet (-500 calories) for 12 weeks, to evaluate weight loss, antioxidant markers and disease activity.
Supplementation of 1g of soybean oil, 3 times a day, and hypocaloric diet (-500 calories) for 12 weeks, to evaluate weight loss, antioxidant markers and disease activity.
Supplementation of 1g soybean oil, 3 times a day.
